image.altText: Anthony Albanese plane

props.synopsis: The historic decision foreshadowed last month has now become a reality, as Australia moves with Canada and the United Kingdom to join the growing list of countries to recognise Palestinian sovereignty.

title.children: Australia formally recognises state of Palestine

image.altText: A man waves a Palestinian flag in front of police officers at Parliament House.

props.synopsis: While the Israel Defense Forces bomb Gaza and bulldoze the West Bank for settlements, moves to recognise Palestine in pursuit of a two-state solution may appear like something of a sick joke.

title.children: As Israel bombs Gaza, recognition of Palestine is a last-gasp effort

image.altText: A woman uses her phone outside an Optus store as a man looks at his.

props.synopsis: Optus reveals that in addition to customers in South Australia, Western Australia and the Northern Territory, two people in New South Wales were unable to connect to emergency services during the 13-hour outage last Thursday.

title.children: Optus triple-0 outage wider than first reported, CEO admits

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump holding a pen over an executive order he just signed

props.synopsis: The massive fee hike prompted a panicked reaction from big tech companies, but the US government says workers already on the visa won't be affected.

title.children: White House says new $100k H-1B visa fees won't apply to current workers

image.altText: Nicola Olyslagers holds up a Australia flag

props.synopsis: Nicola Olyslagers won a superb gold medal in a women's high jump that was twice suspended for torrential rain on the final day of the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo.

title.children: Olyslagers wins fantastic gold as rain hits final day

image.altText: Donald Trump stands beneath a US flag billowing in a breeze

props.synopsis: The Trump administration saw an opportunity to crack down on liberal groups in the wake of the death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. But not all conservatives are onboard.

title.children: Republicans divided in free speech quagmire after Charlie Kirk's death

image.altText: Oscar Piastri of Australia and McLaren climbs out of his damaged car

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri's worst weekend of 2025 ended with a false start, then a lap one crash, but he retains a healthy championship lead after his teammate failed to capitalise.

title.children: Piastri crashes out of F1 grand prix with 'silly' mistake on lap one

image.altText: A man celebrates after scoring a try

props.synopsis: Canterbury is a team built in Penrith's image, but the Panthers served Canterbury a stark reminder that there can be only one.

title.children: How Penrith sent a chilling reminder that nobody does it like them

image.altText: A white jet flying at night over a city with lights on

props.synopsis: British fighter jets fly their first NATO air defence unit over Poland as part of a mission to bolster the Western alliance's defences following a Russian drone incursion this month.

title.children: UK fighter jets begin NATO air defence mission over Poland

image.altText: A girl with dark hair and wearing a bright top does a peace sign while smiling

props.synopsis: Vassy dropped out of the contest at the last minute after coming under what Russian organisers said was "unprecedented political pressure from the government of Australia".

title.children: Australian singer drops out of Russian contest after 'political pressure'

image.altText: A woman carries a bright green drink a a dish with fruit and a syringe with pistachio cream in it.

props.synopsis: Pistachios have become the food flavour of the season, and a lot of work goes into predicting what the next big thing will be.

title.children: 'We didn't know it was going to be as huge as it was': How pistachios become so popular

image.altText: Anthony Albanese close up, with Chris Bowen in background.

props.synopsis: As Anthony Albanese touches down in New York ahead of the UN General Assembly, Republicans issue a warning against formally recognising Palestinian statehood.

title.children: Republicans warn PM of 'punitive measures' over Palestinian recognition

props.synopsis: In New York for the UN summit, Energy Minister Chris Bowen declines to offer a renewable energy target for 2035 after the Climate Change Authority projected more than 90 per cent would be needed to hit its recommended emissions target.

title.children: Government has not set 2035 renewables target, downplays 90pc

image.altText: Liberal MP Vincent Tarzia addresses the media.

props.synopsis: The SA opposition has promised to introduce 50 cent fares for all public transport, if elected in March next year.

title.children: SA opposition promises to slash public transport fares to 50 cents if elected

image.altText: Woman staring off to the side of the camera.

props.synopsis: Karenne Mosley was diagnosed with aggressive uterine cancer in March. She was booked in for surgery twice but is now in palliative care.

title.children: Former nurse 'extremely angry' after cancer deemed inoperable

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair swept in a French twist smiles in warm lighting

props.synopsis: Away from the public eye, Katharine, the Duchess of Kent, was a trailblazer quietly changing lives.

title.children: The Duchess of Kent renounced her title in 2002 and never looked back

image.altText: An old playground in an eerie plain with red dirt and dry grass.

props.synopsis: There's an eerie silence in Ninga Mia, a once thriving community on the edge of Kalgoorlie. The Aboriginal reserve is a microcosm of the cycle of displacement endured by many First Nations people.

title.children: How a forgotten village in the city of gold decayed into such squalor

image.altText: Man at the beach looks off into the distance. There is a jetty behind him.

props.synopsis: Experts are calling for new regulations on artificial intelligence chatbots, after a triple j hack investigation uncovered a disturbing example of a chatbot encouraging a man to murder his father while engaging in paedophilic role-play.

title.children: Australian man encouraged to murder his father by AI chatbot

image.altText: Paul Alamoti and Izack Tago celebrate

props.synopsis: Penrith has crushed Canterbury-Bankstown after a phenomenal first half to claim a 46-26 victory, keeping their hopes of a fifth-consecutive NRL premiership alive.

title.children: Penrith keep five-peat alive with dominant win over Bulldogs

image.altText: Dayne Zorko grabs at Mason Cox's eyewear.

props.synopsis: Brisbane Lions stalwart Dayne Zorko is punished by the AFL after he ripped off Mason Cox's glasses during their fiery preliminary final clash.

title.children: Lions veteran Zorko fined by AFL for targeting Cox's glasses

image.altText: A police officer with his back turned to the camera.

props.synopsis: Detectives from the Major Crime Division are investigating the death near a popular park in the Goldfields city early on Sunday morning.

title.children: Critically injured man dies after being found along Kalgoorlie street

image.altText: A fresh water crocodile looking at the camera while resting his chin

props.synopsis: It's crocodile breeding season and at one central Queensland farm, the drama is on par with a reality television dating show as keepers try to work out the best pairings.

title.children: 'You can start losing crocs': The high-risk game of crocodile matchmaking

image.altText: Side view of woman throwing a baby into the air but baby shape is cut out and blank

props.synopsis: Elon Musk believes the collapsing birth rate is humanity's biggest danger. But antinatalists argue having kids is little more than a procreational Ponzi scheme, and the risks are real.

title.children: The confronting climate change disrupter you probably didn't think of

image.altText: emergency services at a crash on  the m2 at macquarie park

props.synopsis: A bus driver is among 11 people hospitalised after a bus and a car crash on the M2 at Macquarie Park in what emergency responders described as a "complex incident".

title.children: Multiple people hospitalised after bus and car crash on busy Sydney motorway

image.altText: AFL Captains

props.synopsis: The 21st century has been dominated by four AFL clubs — Geelong, Hawthorn, Collingwood and Brisbane — but there's no single secret to their success.

title.children: How the elite four of the AFL stay so good

image.altText: Eden Zanker celebrates a Demons goal in their AFLW match against the Eagles.

props.synopsis: The Demons' Eden Zanker enjoys a day out with five goals to help defeat Daisy Pearce's young Eagles squad by 51 points, while the Crows launch a final-quarter fightback to get past the Suns.

title.children: Demons deny Pearce happy homecoming, Crows pull off great escape

image.altText: Multiple bikes race on a sand track.

props.synopsis: The MXGP championships have returned to Australia for the first time in more than two decades, with the world's best riders descending on Darwin to test their skills in a competition broadcast to more than 100 countries.

title.children: The world's best motocross riders and their bikes descend on Darwin

image.altText: A group of young Aboriginal children sit in a row, wearing traditional paints, with a smiling woman behind them.

props.synopsis: In 1975, an anthropologist wrote his thesis on Carnarvon's rich Aboriginal reserve. Decades later, traditional owners revisit the work to contribute to "big truth-telling" documentary.

title.children: New documentary explores complex history of life in town's Aboriginal reserve

image.altText: Young woman sorting wardrobe indoors at home.

props.synopsis: It's the kind of task that can seem overwhelming, but the change of season is the perfect opportunity to review what's in your wardrobe.

title.children: How to tackle an overcrowded and overwhelming wardrobe

image.altText: police officer in navy amid a group of more than a dozen people dressed in a mix of casual wear and workwear in carpark.

props.synopsis: Driving a car or riding a bike may be essential for temporary migrants studying or working in Australia, but hook turns, wombat crossings, and roundabouts can be unfamiliar territory. Here are some locals working to change that.

title.children: These Aussies are making roads safer for overseas drivers

image.altText: A female tennis player in white with racket stands beside her mother in grey.

props.synopsis: Cara Korhonen played on Rod Laver Arena when she was 10 years of age and is putting her blood, sweat and tears into setting foot on there again.

title.children: Tennis dreams come at a cost as you lose money even when you win

image.altText: A woman smiles for a photo while holding a large bouquet of orange flowers and baby's breath

props.synopsis: A Pakistani court charges a 22-year-old man with murder for shooting a teenage social media influencer, Sana Yousaf, after refusing his offer of friendship.

title.children: Man formally charged with murdering Pakistani TikTok influencer

image.altText: A man with dark hair stands in front of a tree and smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: Mildura marks two decades since its Koori Court opened, as Victoria sees mixed results in the push to reduce Indigenous incarceration and offending rates.

title.children: Koori Court looks to treaty after 20 years in north-west Victoria

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: I like your trivia enthusiasm, but be careful — you're about to taste defeat.

title.children: Alright Brainiac, I've seen your type before. It's time to play … HARD!

image.altText: man smiling

props.synopsis: Court documents allege a 53-year-old Queensland man ran a fake whale euthanasia charity to traffic assisted suicide drugs.

title.children: Whale charity boss allegedly ran euthanasia body 'discovery service'
